intro: Asplundia dussii, commonly known as the Dussi's arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stem and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Asplundia dussii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade.
